name: Magnolia Hotel Denver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent stay for a one night getaway - everyone was friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable. We stayed in the fireplace suite, and it was unique with tons of room. Loved the happy hour and free breakfast!
reviews.title: Great Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hidden gem in the heart of Denver. Wonderful service and the most comfortable beds in the city. Make sure you use the hotels complementary transportation to Elway's steakhouse located at the Ritz- a few blocks away. Don't miss the complementary beer and wine reception and evening cookies and milk. Also.... the Starbucks delivers fresh directly to your room. Can't beat that. All of that and it's the best value in town.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Denver!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: First visit here, and definitely coming back again! Customer service makes all the difference. Cocktail hour was great, as well as the cookies later that night. A warm breakfast self service was included as well, and it was very good!
reviews.title: Great staff - Excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Superior customer service and a knack for doing the little things right. This is a great hotel with a very comfortable and updated decor. They focus on making you feel very oriented and comfortable at the front desk and the experience and amenities speak for themselves. Go here instead of the big chains.
reviews.title: This is a gem of a hotel with superior customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Magnolia hotel is everything is promises to be. A great location steps from 16th street with lots of charm. I stayed for the first time to celebrate a birthday. We received a free upgrade to a fireplace suite and a bottle of wine. The room was comfortable and almost too large. The bed was clean and easy to 'sink into.' My only complaint is there was little vanity space in the bathroom and the light switches were all in odd places. The cookies at bedtime and breakfast in the morning were both better than expected and served in a comfortable great-room with a waterfall and a billiards table. The valet service was great but even more expensive than expected at $26 per night. There is an attached garage for self-parking that I wish I had used.
reviews.title: Downtown Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay one night at Magnolia Hotel, as the hotel we used to stay is being renovated. We did the right decision! It is amazing to see that all staff has always a smile for you. Service (reception, concierge, restaurant, valet) is impressing, fast, and of high standard.
reviews.title: Nice stay in Denver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located, close to main atractions and LoDo. Ratio price/quality is excellent. We stayed in a fireplace suite which has all the confort one could desire. From now on, Magnolia Hotel will be our hotel in Denver!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, cookies n milk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here while in Denver for a few days last week. The hotel is located a block from the 16th Street Mall in Downtown Denver. Very convenient location for us since we chose not to rent a car. There's a free bus that goes up and down the 16th Street Mall to get you to lots of food, entertainment, and shopping choices.
reviews.title: Great Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, the room was nice, bed was ok (not the most comfortable, but certainly not bad). Breakfast was hot and fresh and varied by day, which was better than having the same thing every day. Happy hour and cookies and milk every night were also a nice treat.
reviews.title: I stayed here for one week. It is an excellent place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: The Romantic Magnolia Hotel Denver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was our 2nd visit.We love the boutique feel. everyone was professional and friendly. Erin left a lovely note and helped us really celebrate our anniversary! the room and fireplace were lovely.good location for hockey game, 16 st mall,nice walk & free trolley when your too cold to walk.over-all absolutely no regrets
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One good experience could be lucky, but my husband and I have stayed at the Magnolia 2 times since and it is consistently PERFECT! Professional, knowledgeable, friendly staff - Beautiful, comfortable guest rooms - and great modern little bar (Harry's)!!! The amenities - breakfast, wine, shuttle service, cookies and milk - all above and beyond!
reviews.title: Consistently Perfect! Best Hotel in Denver!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend for business or a romantic evening! The fireplace suites are worth the extra. I agree with the traveler who said employees love what they do and are very friendly!
reviews.title: Excellent "mini-moon"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for just couple days after getting married. Erin Strong, the concierge, is an example of top notch professionalism. I was in commucation with her months in advance regarding the room choice and some special touches during our stay. She was willing to do anything to help make it special... and she did. I had ice cream shipped from our home state to the hotel and she took care of it for us until our stay, when it was delivered to our room.
reviews.title: Most comfortable hotel room every stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a suite on one of the top floors. It was quiet and had a great view. We actually never left the hotel.
reviews.title: Delivers Value Beyond Price Point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I spent four nights at the Magnolia in Denver in February 2013. As a hotel conversion (I was told that it was formerly an apartment building) it has a lot of charm and was well-appointed. My room was relatively small in the bedroom area but still more than adequate. The bathroom was very nice with an oval tub that make the space look more luxurious. Although I did not have the opportunity to sample any of the area attractions, it is very convenient to good restaurants and shopping. A bonus is that you can order from the Starbucks in the hotel and they will deliver it to your room! Great when you're up working early. My only suggestion for improvement would be the bed - a bit firm and almost lumpy for my taste but probably fine for most people.
reviews.title: A lovely place for business in Denver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel with my wife and our 5 kids in two double queen rooms. The hotel is situated in downtown Denver with only a few yards walk to the 16th street mall. Its perfect for exploring the nightlife in downtown. The rooms were quite small, especially for 4 persons, but functionally furnished. The Staff was friendly, the breakfast was very good. Overall a pleasant experience - i would recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a Colorado native, I've taken many "staycations" in Denver. I always try to find a new, fun place to stay and thought I'd try The Magnolia. It was OK, but I felt like I was way over-charged for the room. The bed was very hard, the bathroom seemed like it was done DIY and not professionally, and the bathtub was dirty. I have stayed in much nicer Denver hotels with more impressive rooms for much less. The free cocktail hour was nice and Harry's Bar was fantastic, but I will not be staying here again.
reviews.title: Nice, but overpriced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Great hotel great location. Staff ciuld have been more helpful in getting the rate that I found online. I had to extend my stay for two nights and asked front desk to check with reservationd to see if I could get internet price $22 less. The front desk called me back and said they couldn't get that rate. I checked on two different hotel sites and both had the less expensive rates. Stay was great but left with bad feeling. Many choices downtown that have better service. I even asked at check out and still nothing. I stay here every year during my Denver trip but never again.
reviews.title: Booked online then added two nights and hotel wouldn't match the online price I found for the extra two nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We won a night at this hotel and it was very attractive and centrally located in the middle of downtown. Our room was nicely kept and comfortable. Complimentary happy hour, bedtime snacks and breakfast along with internet access is always a bonus. Very nice breakfast spread included in hotel stay. Seems like its suited more for business with meeting rooms. They do lack gym and pool facilities, but worth a try when you stay in the city! Service was excellent!
reviews.title: Cool spot in middle of downtown!

description: This downtown Denver hotel features guestrooms and suites ideal for extended stay, corporate, and leisure travelers near many city attractions, restaurants, and entertainment venues.
